message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.AI. 

The paper is about improving the performance of Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) in Large Vocabulary Continuous Speech Recognition (LVCSR) systems. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and speech recognition. The paper also introduces a very deep CNN architecture with multiple convolutional layers, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper proposes multilingual CNNs and multi-scale input features, which could fall under cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), respectively. Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed methods on a low resource speech recognition task, which could also make it relevant to cs.LG (Machine Learning).
